intro: Crotalaria rigida, commonly known as rigid crownflower, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant has erect, branched stems and produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in disturbed soils and along roadsides. Crotalaria rigida is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil, making it beneficial for soil enrichment.
